content.text: Core-Mark Holding ( NASDAQ : CORE ) reports Non-cigarette sales rose 5.7 % in Q4 , primarily due to the growing popularity of alternative nicotine delivery products , and strong sales of candy and fresh foods . Cigarette sales dropped 2 % , driven by declines in cigarette consumption . Gross margin rate improved 17 bps to 5.31 % , driven by a shift in sales mix towards higher margin non-cigarette products . Adjusted EBITDA up 2.4 % to $ 39M . FY2019 Guidance : Net sales : $ 16.8 to $ 17B ; Adjusted EBITDA : $ 176 to $ 182M ; Diluted EPS : 1.09 to $ 1.19 ; Diluted EPS ( excl . LIFO expense ) : $ 1.50 to $ 1.60 ; Capex : ~ $ 30M ; Tax rate : 25 % ; Fully diluted shares outstanding : 46M . Previously : Core-Mark Holding beats by $ 0.03 , beats on revenue ( March 1 ) Now read : AMC Entertainment +9 % after attendance improves in Q4 "
